meanings.definition: To create a dummy or model of something.
meanings.sent1: She dummied up a small version of the robot for the science fair.
meanings.sent2: The architect dummied a miniature replica of the building before construction.
meanings.sent3: He dummied a paper car that looked like a tiny toy.
meanings.sent4: The artist dummied a clay figure to plan the sculpture.
meanings.sent5: They dummied a cardboard house to practice their design skills.

meanings.definition: To manipulate or falsify data or information.
meanings.sent1: The student dummied the test results to get a higher grade.
meanings.sent2: The fraudster dummied the financial records to hide the embezzlement.
meanings.sent3: He dummied the report to make it seem like he did more work.
meanings.sent4: The hacker dummied the security logs to cover their tracks.
meanings.sent5: She dummied the evidence to frame someone else for the crime.

meanings.definition: To silence or muffle a sound.
meanings.sent1: She dummied the loud alarm by pressing the button.
meanings.sent2: The teacher dummied the noisy classroom by raising her hand.
meanings.sent3: He dummied the barking dog by giving it a treat.
meanings.sent4: The musician dummied the loud drum by using a mute.
meanings.sent5: They dummied the blaring music by adjusting the volume.
